intro: Premna coriacea var. cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf premna, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has ovate to elliptic leaves with a rough, textured surface. The leaves are usually dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside, with a serrated margin. It produces small, clustered white flowers followed by small, three-lobed berries. This plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
